column1: - Bend at the knees, not your waist, to pick things up.
Avoid medicines such as aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), or naproxen (Aleve, Naprosyn).
Take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to relieve pain.
Other over-the-counter drugs and prescription drugs can treat GERD.

There are two different types of these drugs: - H2 antagonists: famotidine (Pepcid), cimetidine (Tagamet), ranitidine (Zantac), and nizatidine (Axid) - Proton pump inhibitors (PPI): omeprazole (Prilosec or Zegarid), esomeprazole (Nexium), lansoprazole (Prevacid), dexlansoprazole (Dexilant), rabeprazole (AcipHex), and pantoprazole (Protonix)
GERD can cause the enamel on your teeth to wear away.
